name: Dr Emma Williams
background_summary: Dr Emma Williams is a leading expert in dementia care with over 27 years of experience. She holds a PhD in Psychology from Bangor University and has dedicated her career to improving the lives of people with dementia. As the founder of EmWill Care, she is pioneering the integration of behavioural science and smart technology to address distress in dementia care, notably through the 'Less Distress' tool. She previously founded PACT (Positive Ageing Consultancy & Training) and has held senior roles such as Director of Training for the North Wales Regional Partnership Board. Dr Williams is actively involved in accelerator programs with the Alzheimer's Society and Business Wales, and is recognized for her thought leadership and commitment to compassionate, innovative care.

previous_companies.description: Founded and led a consultancy focused on positive ageing and dementia care, providing training and behavioural consultancy services.
Led training initiatives and provided strategic direction for dementia care programs across the region.

public_speaking_or_content.title: Showcasing 'Less Distress' at London Tech Week
